snippet: A group led by the N.A.A.C.P. has asked for the appointment of a special prosecutor in the killing of Michael Brown.
abstract: Protesters led by NAACP march from Ferguson, Mo, to Jefferson City in effort to urge Gov Jay Nixon to appoint special prosecutor to examine killing of Michael Brown by Police Officer Darren Wilson; St Louis grand jury's decision not to indict Wilson has spurred outrage nationwide.

byline.contributor: Alan Blinder contributed reporting from Atlanta and Monica Davey from Chicago.

lead_paragraph: A group led by the N.A.A.C.P. has asked for the appointment of a special prosecutor in the killing of Michael Brown.

headline.main: Ferguson Protesters Reach the Missouri Capital With Their Message
headline.print_headline: Ferguson Protesters Reach the Missouri Capital With Their Message

keywords.value: National Assn for the Advancement of Colored People
keywords.name: organizations
